poem:
In Memoriam  

Lawrence Wilson, a master in quiet rooms,  
held breaths steady, hearts softly beating.  
In his final hours, memories flowed like anesthesia  
from colleagues who wove his life into theirs—  
each story a gentle stitch,  
a whisper of gratitude,  
a lesson in grace,  
moving across the pale linens  
of a life well tended.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Lawrence Wilson obituary My friend and colleague Lawrence Wilson, who has died aged 52 of a stroke, trained a generation of anaesthetists in the north-west of England and led the intensive care unit at the Countess of Chester hospital during the pandemic. The respect and affection with which he was held was made clear during his own final days in hospital, as every clinician who looked after him had a fondly remembered story to tell.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
